intro: Serruria cygnea, commonly known as the silver serruria, is a South African plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its evergreen, narrow, needle-like leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery-white pubescence. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. It is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
